Description: Fake mould-made pottery lamp of Hellenistic type, with rounded shoulders decorated in relief with bands of studs and voluted tendrils. Around the filling-hole is a band of short rays. The top of the nozzle is decorated with a head of Egyptian style, perhaps Hathor. At the rear is an applied pierced handle. The underside is pared to shape.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q3463)
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: E B W Chapplowe
